trait.name: Source
trait.text: Monster Manual, p. 85

trait.name: Living Shadow
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the dragon has resistance to damage that isn't force, psychic, or radiant.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the dragon can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the dragon has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10+6) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6+6) slashing damage.

action.name: Shadow Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dragon exhales shadowy fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 56 (16d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A humanoid reduced to 0 hit points by this damage dies, and an undead shadow rises from its corpse and acts immediately after the dragon in the initiative count. The shadow is under the dragon's control.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Monster Manual, p. 258

trait.name: Heated Body
trait.text: A creature that touches the remorhaz or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d10+4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Monster Manual, p. 118

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10+6) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6+6) slashing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapons (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

Cold Breath. The dragon exhales an icy blast in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Paralyzing Breath. The dragon exhales paralyzing gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Paralyzed:
• A paralyzed creature is incapacitated, meaning it can't take actions or reactions, and can't move or speak.
• The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage.
• Any attack that hits the creature is a critical hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature.

monster.name: Young White Dragon
monster.speed: 40 ft., burrow 20 ft., fly 80 ft., swim 40 ft.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Monster Manual, p. 101

trait.name: Ice Walk
trait.text: The dragon can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra moment.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10+4) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) cold damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) slashing damage.

action.name: Cold Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dragon exhales an icy blast in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Yuan-ti Abomination

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Monster Manual, p. 308

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Large snake, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It doesn't change form if it dies.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting (Abomination Form Only)
trait.text: The yuan-ti's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). The yuan-ti can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: animal friendship (snakes only)
3/day: suggestion
1/day: fear

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Variant: Acid Slime
trait.text: As a bonus action, the yuan-ti can coat its body in a slimy acid that lasts for 1 minute. A creature that touches the yuan-ti, hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it, or is hit by its constrict attack takes 5 (1d10) acid damage.

trait.name: Variant: Chameleon Skin
trait.text: The yuan-ti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Variant: Shed Skin (1/Day)
trait.text: The yuan-ti can shed its skin as a bonus action to free itself from a grapple, shackles, or other restraints. If the yuan-ti spends 1 minute eating its shed skin, it regains hit points equal to half its hit point maximum.

action.name: Multiattack (Abomination Form Only)
action.text: The yuan-ti makes two ranged attacks or three melee attacks, but can use its bite and constrict attacks only once each.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d6+4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

action.name: Constrict
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the yuan-ti can't constrict another target.

action.name: Scimitar (Abomination Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow (Abomination Form Only)
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8+3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

action.name: Variant: Polymorph into Snake (Recharge 6)
action.text: The yuan-ti targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be transformed into a Tint poisonous snake, as if affected by the polymorph spell.

action.name: Variant: Snake Antipathy (Recharge 6)
action.text: The yuan-ti targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or feel an intense urge to avoid snakes and snakelike creatures (including yuan-ti), as if affected by the antipathy effect of an antipathy/sympathy spell.

action.name: Variant: Sticks to Snakes (Recharge 6)
action.text: The yuan-ti transforms a pile of sticks, arrows, or similar-sized pieces of wood into a swarm of poisonous snakes. The swarm acts as an ally of the yuan-ti and obeys its spoken commands. The swarm remains for 1 minute, after which it turns back into the original materials.

monster.spells: animal friendship, suggestion, fear

monster.name: Yuan-ti Anathema

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Volo's Guide to Monsters, p. 202

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting (Anathema Form Only)
trait.text: The anathema’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: animal friendship (snakes only)
3/day each: darkness, entangle, fear, haste, suggestion, polymorph
1/day: divine word

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The anathema has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Ophidiophobia Aura
trait.text: Any creature of the anathema’s choice, other than a snake or a yuan-ti, that starts its turn within 30 feet of the anathema and can see or hear it must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of snakes and yuan-ti. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this aura for the next 24 hours.
Frightened:
• A frightened creature has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls while the source of its fear is within line of sight.
• The creature can't willingly move closer to the source of its fear.

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The anathema can use its action to polymorph into a Huge giant constrictor snake, or back into its true form. its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

trait.name: Six Heads
trait.text: The anathema has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded. charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

trait.name: Variant: Acid Slime
trait.text: As a bonus action, the yuan-ti can coat its body in a slimy acid that lasts for 1 minute. A creature that touches the yuan-ti, hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it, or is hit by its constrict attack takes 5 (1d10) acid damage.

trait.name: Variant: Chameleon Skin
trait.text: The yuan-ti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Variant: Shed Skin (1/Day)
trait.text: The yuan-ti can shed its skin as a bonus action to free itself from a grapple, shackles, or other restraints. If the yuan-ti spends 1 minute eating its shed skin, it regains hit points equal to half its hit point maximum.

action.name: Multiattack (Anathema Form Only)
action.text: The anathema makes two claw attacks, one constrict attack, and one Flurry of Bites attack.

action.name: Claw (Anathema Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6+6) slashing damage.

action.name: Constrict
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: 16 (3d6+6) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and takes 16 (3d6+6) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns, and the anathema can’t constrict another target.
Grappled:
• A grappled creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• The condition ends if the grappler is incapacitated.
• The condition also ends if an effect removes the grappled creature from the reach of the grappler or grappling effect, such as when a creature is hurled away by the thunderwave spell.
Restrained:
• A restrained creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.
• The creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

action.name: Flurry of Bites
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 27 (6d6+6) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage.

monster.spells: animal friendship, darkness, entangle, fear, haste, suggestion, polymorph, divine word

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Volo's Guide to Monsters, p. 203

trait.name: Mental Resistance
trait.text: The broodguard has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t paralyze it.

trait.name: Reckless
trait.text: At the start of its turn, the broodguard can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Variant: Chameleon Skin
trait.text: The yuan-ti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Variant: Shed Skin (1/Day)
trait.text: The yuan-ti can shed its skin as a bonus action to free itself from a grapple, shackles, or other restraints. If the yuan-ti spends 1 minute eating its shed skin, it regains hit points equal to half its hit point maximum.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The broodguard makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) slashing damage.

action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow (Yuan-ti Form Only)
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

action.name: Variant: Polymorph into Snake (Recharge 6)
action.text: The yuan-ti targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be transformed into a Tint poisonous snake, as if affected by the polymorph spell.

action.name: Variant: Snake Antipathy (Recharge 6)
action.text: The yuan-ti targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or feel an intense urge to avoid snakes and snakelike creatures (including yuan-ti), as if affected by the antipathy effect of an antipathy/sympathy spell.

action.name: Variant: Sticks to Snakes (Recharge 6)
action.text: The yuan-ti transforms a pile of sticks, arrows, or similar-sized pieces of wood into a swarm of poisonous snakes. The swarm acts as an ally of the yuan-ti and obeys its spoken commands. The swarm remains for 1 minute, after which it turns back into the original materials.

monster.spells: animal friendship, suggestion

monster.name: Yuan-ti Mind Whisperer

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Volo's Guide to Monsters, p. 204

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Medium snake or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. If it dies, it stays in its current form.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
trait.text: The yuan-ti’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). The yuan-ti can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: animal friendship (snakes only)
3/day: suggestion

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Mind Fangs (2/Day)
trait.text: The first time the yuan-ti hits with a melee attack on its turn, it can deal an extra 16 (3d10) psychic damage to the target.

trait.name: Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
trait.text: The yuan-ti is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:
Cantrips (at will): eldritch blast (range 300 ft., +3 bonus to each damage roll),friends, message, minor illusion, poison spray, prestidigitation
1st-3rd level (2 3rd-level slots): charm person, crown of madness, detect thoughts, expeditious retreat, fly, hypnotic pattern, illusory script

trait.name: Sseth’s Blessing
trait.text: When the yuan-ti reduces an enemy to 0 hit points, the yuan-ti gains 9 temporary hit points.

trait.name: Variant: Chameleon Skin
trait.text: The yuan-ti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Variant: Shed Skin (1/Day)
trait.text: The yuan-ti can shed its skin as a bonus action to free itself from a grapple, shackles, or other restraints. If the yuan-ti spends 1 minute eating its shed skin, it regains hit points equal to half its hit point maximum.

action.name: Multiattack (Yuan-ti Form Only)
action.text: The yuan-ti makes one bite attack and one scimitar attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

action.name: Scimitar (Yuan-ti Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) slashing damage.

monster.spells: animal friendship, suggestion, eldritch blast, friends, message, minor illusion, poison spray, prestidigitation, charm person, crown of madness, detect thoughts, expeditious retreat, fly, hypnotic pattern, illusory script

monster.name: Yuan-ti Nightmare Speaker

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Volo's Guide to Monsters, p. 205

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Medium snake or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. If it dies, it stays in its current form.

trait.name: Death Fangs (2/Day)
trait.text: The first time the yuan-ti hits with a melee attack on its turn, it can deal an extra 16 (3d10) necrotic damage to the target.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
trait.text: The yuan-ti’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). The yuan-ti can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: animal friendship (snakes only) 3/day: suggestion

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
trait.text: The yuan-ti is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:
Cantrip (at will): chill touch, eldritch blast (range 300 ft., +3 bonus to each damage roll), mage hand, message, poison spray, prestidigitation
1st-3rd level (2 3rd-level slots): arms of Hadar, darkness, fear, hex, hold person, hunger of Hadar, witch bolt

trait.name: Variant: Chameleon Skin
trait.text: The yuan-ti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Variant: Shed Skin (1/Day)
trait.text: The yuan-ti can shed its skin as a bonus action to free itself from a grapple, shackles, or other restraints. If the yuan-ti spends 1 minute eating its shed skin, it regains hit points equal to half its hit point maximum.

action.name: Multiattack (Yuan-ti Form Only)
action.text: The yuan-ti makes one constrict attack and one scimitar attack.

action.name: Constrict
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6+3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the yuan-ti can’t constrict another target.
Grappled:
• A grappled creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• The condition ends if the grappler is incapacitated.
• The condition also ends if an effect removes the grappled creature from the reach of the grappler or grappling effect, such as when a creature is hurled away by the thunderwave spell.
Restrained:
• A restrained creature's speed becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.
• The creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

action.name: Scimitar (Yuan-ti Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) slashing damage.

action.name: Invoke Nightmare (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The yuan-ti taps into the nightmares of a creature it can see within 60 feet of it and creates an illusory, immobile manifestation of the creature’s deepest fears, visible only to that creature. The target must make a DC 13 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 11 (2d10) psychic damage and is frightened of the manifestation, believing it to be real. The yuan-ti must concentrate to maintain the illusion (as if concentrating on a spell), which lasts for up to 1 minute and can’t be harmed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the illusion on a success, or taking 11 (2d10) psychic damage on a failure.
Frightened:
• A frightened creature has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls while the source of its fear is within line of sight.
• The creature can't willingly move closer to the source of its fear.

monster.spells: animal friendship, suggestion, chill touch, eldritch blast, mage hand, message, poison spray, prestidigitation, arms of Hadar, darkness, fear, hex, hold person, hunger of Hadar, witch bolt

monster.name: Yuan-ti Pit Master

trait.name: Source

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Medium snake or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It doesn't change form if it dies.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
trait.text: The yuan-ti’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). The yuan-ti can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: animal friendship (snakes only) 3/day: suggestion

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Poison’s Disciple (2/Day)
trait.text: The first time the yuan-ti hits with a melee attack on its turn, it can deal an extra 16 (3d10) poison damage to the target.

trait.name: Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Farm Only)
trait.text: The yuan-ti is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:
Cantrips (at will): eldritch blast (range 300 ft., +3 bonus to each damage roll), friends, guidance, mage hand, message, poison spray
1st-3rd level (2 3rd-level slots): command, counterspell, hellish rebuke, invisibility, misty step, unseen servant, vampiric touch

trait.name: Variant: Chameleon Skin
trait.text: The yuan-ti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Variant: Shed Skin (1/Day)
trait.text: The yuan-ti can shed its skin as a bonus action to free itself from a grapple, shackles, or other restraints. If the yuan-ti spends 1 minute eating its shed skin, it regains hit points equal to half its hit point maximum.

action.name: Multiattack (Yuan-ti Form Only)
action.text: The yuan-ti makes two bite attacks using its snake arms.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

action.name: Merrshaulk's Slumber (1/Day)
action.text: The yuan-ti targets up to five creatures that it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or fall into a magical sleep and be unconscious for 10 minutes. A sleeping target awakens if it takes damage or if someone uses an action to shake or slap it awake. This magical sleep has no effect on a creature immune to being charmed.
Unconscious:
• An unconscious creature is incapacitated, meaning it can't take actions or reactions, can't move or speak, and is unaware of its surroundings.
• The creature drops whatever it's holding and falls prone.
• The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws.
• Attack rolls against the creature have advantage.
• Any attack that hits the creature is a critical hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature.

monster.spells: animal friendship, suggestion, eldritch blast, friends, guidance, mage hand, message, poison spray, command, counterspell, hellish rebuke, invisibility, misty step, unseen servant, vampiric touch

monster.name: Yuan-ti Pureblood

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Monster Manual, p. 310

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The yuan-ti's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). The yuan-ti can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: animal friendship (snakes only)
3/day each: poison spray, suggestion

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Variant: Chameleon Skin
trait.text: The yuan-ti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Variant: Shapechanger
trait.text: The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Medium giant poisonous snake, or into a Large constrictor snake, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form, except for the size change noted.. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It doesn't change form if it dies.

trait.name: Variant: Shed Skin (1/Day)
trait.text: The yuan-ti can shed its skin as a bonus action to free itself from a grapple, shackles, or other restraints. If the yuan-ti spends 1 minute eating its shed skin, it regains hit points equal to half its hit point maximum.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The yuan-ti makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

action.name: Variant: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 3 (1d4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage. If the pureblood uses Multiattack, it can make two melee attacks, but can only use its bite once.

monster.spells: animal friendship, poison spray, suggestion

monster.name: Yusdrayl

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tales from the Yawning Portal, p. 248

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Yusdrayl is a 2nd-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). She knows the following sorcerer spells:
Cantrips (at will): mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost, shocking grasp
1st level (4 slots): burning hands, chromatic orb, mage armor

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, Yusdrayl has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: Yusdrayl has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of her allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.spells: mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost, shocking grasp, burning hands, chromatic orb, mage armor

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Storm King's Thunder, p. 251

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
trait.text: While Zi is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, her AC includes her Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Roleplaying Information
trait.text: Zi Liang is a devout worshiper of Chauntea, the Earth Mother. She has considerably less faith in Goldenfields' defenders, so she patrols the temple-farm during her off-duty hours.
Ideal: "If we faithfully tend to our gardens and our fields, Chauntea will smile upon us."
Bond: "Goldenfields is the breadbasket of the North. People depend on its safety and prosperity, and I'll do what must be done to protect it."
Flaw: "I don't trust authority. I do what my heart says is right."

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Zi makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) bludgeoning damage, or 5 (1d8+1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Sling
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) bludgeoning damage. Zi carries twenty sling stones.

monster.name: Zindar

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tomb of Annihilation, p. 239

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Zindar is a 14th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). Zindar knows the following sorcerer spells:
Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, friends, light, mage hand, mending, message
1st level (6 slots): magic missile, shield, sleep
2nd level (4 slots): detect thoughts, knock
3rd level (3 slots): clairvoyance, tongues
4th level (3 slots): dominate beast, stoneskin
5th level (3 slots): hold monster, telekinesis
6th level (1 slot): true seeing
7th level (1 slot): fire storm

trait.name: Dragon Wings
trait.text: As a bonus action on his turn, Zindar can sprout a pair of dragon wings from his back, gaining a flying speed of 30 feet until he dismisses them as a bonus action.

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) bludgeoning damage, or 6 (1d8+2) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Zindar uses one of the following options:

Fire Breath: Zindar exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Weakening Breath: Zindar exhales gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or have disadvantage on Strength-based attack rolls, Strength checks, and Strength saving throws for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.spells: fire bolt, friends, light, mage hand, mending, message, magic missile, shield, sleep, detect thoughts, knock, clairvoyance, tongues, dominate beast, stoneskin, hold monster, telekinesis, true seeing, fire storm

monster.name: Zombie
monster.languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Monster Manual, p. 316
Player's Handbook, p. 311

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
trait.text: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Tomb of Annihilation, p. 241

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The zorbo has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Natural Armor
trait.text: The zorbo magically absorbs the natural strength of its surroundings, adjusting its Armor Class based on the material it is standing or climbing on: AC 15 for wood or bone, AC 17 for earth or stone, or AC 19 for metal. If the zorbo isn't in contact with any of these substances, itsAC is 10.

action.name: Destructive Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d6 + 1) slashing damage, and if the target is a creature wearing armor, carrying a shield, or in possession of a magic item that improves its AC, it must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, one such item worn or carried by the creature (the target's choice) magically deteriorates, taking a permanent and cumulative _1 penalty to the AC it offers, and the zorbo gains a +1 bonus to AC until the start of its next turn. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield or magic item that drops to a 0 AC increase is destroyed.

monster.name: Zuggtmoy
monster.immune: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing that is nonmagical

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Out of the Abyss p. 248

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Zuggtmoy's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 22). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect magic, locate animals or plants, ray of sickness
3/day each: dispel magic, ensnaring strike, entangle, plant growth
1/day: etherealness, teleport

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Zuggtmoy fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Zuggtmoy has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapon
trait.text: Zuggtmoy's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Zuggtmoy makes four pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8+6) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

action.name: Infestation Spores (3/Day)
action.text: Zuggtmoy releases spores that burst out in cloud fills a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on her, and it lingers for 1 minute. Any flesh-and-blood creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of Zuggtmoy and also gains a random form of madness (determined by rolling on the Madness of Zuggtmoy table) that lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. On a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be (see the "Myconids" entry in the Monster Manual).

action.name: Mind Control Spores (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Zuggtmoy releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on her, and it lingers for 1 minute. Humanoids and beasts in the cloud when it appears, or that enter it later, must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the influence of Zuggtmoy for 24 hours. While infected, the creature is charmed by her and can't be reinfected by these spores.
Charmed:
• A charmed creature can't attack the charmer or target the charmer with harmful abilities or magical effects.
• The charmer has advantage on any ability check to interact socially with the creature.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Zuggtmoy can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Zuggtmoy regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: Zuggtmoy makes one pseudopod attack.

legendary.name: Exert Will
legendary.text: One creature charmed by Zuggtmoy that she can see must use its reaction to move up to its speed as she directs or to make a weapon attack against a target that she designates.

monster.spells: detect magic, locate animals or plants, ray of sickness, dispel magic, ensnaring strike, entangle, plant growth, etherealness, teleport
